titlePart.text: SECTION F MECHANICAL ENGINEERING
LIGHTING
HEATING
WEAPONS
BLASTING
ENGINES AND PUMPS
COMBUSTION ENGINES
titlePart.entryReference: cyclically operating valves therefor, lubricating, exhausting, or silencing engines

titlePart.text: HOT-GAS OR COMBUSTION-PRODUCT ENGINE PLANTS
INTERNAL-COMBUSTION PISTON ENGINES
COMBUSTION ENGINES IN GENERAL
titlePart.entryReference: plants in which engines use combustion products ,

noteParagraph.text: Attention is drawn to the notes preceding class , specially as regards Note 2 (a).
The following words are used with the meanings indicated:
"Positive ignition" means ignition by a source external to the working fluid, e.g. by spark or incandescent source.
"Charging" means forcing air or fuel-air mixture into engine cylinders, and thus embraces supercharging.
"Scavenging" means forcing the combustion residues from the cylinders other than by movement of the working pistons, and thus embraces tuned exhaust systems.
Engines with specified cycles or number of cylinders are classified in group or , unless other classifying features predominate.
